ygData.subject: Re: Sensitvity Analysis and Reaction Path Analysis
ygData.msgSnippet: Rob, Reaction path analysis is possible, but as I recall it never made it into the Fortran version. It can certainly be done in C++. Sensitivity analysis will

Rob,

Reaction path analysis is possible, but as I recall it never made it 
into the Fortran version. It can certainly be done in C++. 
Sensitivity analysis will be added before long. 

I am finding now that Cantera development is rate-limited by 
available time, and the list of things in the works keeps growing. 
Stagnation flows, surface chemistry, a new Python version, and C++ 
documentation are all in progress. I'm going to try to get some of 
them released before I go on vacation in the middle of next week...

Dave



--- In cantera@y..., "rtranteril" <rtranter@t...> wrote:
> David,
> I have recently downloaded the Fortran version of Cantera. So far I 
am 
> impressed with the program and would like to congratulate you on 
> producing this software. I notice in the Fortran manual that it 
should 
> be possible to perform reaction path analyses with the current 
version 
> of Cantera however I have not managed to locate the appropriate 
module 
> for this. Any clues as to where I should look would be appreciated.
> 
> I understand that currently sensistivity analysis cannot be 
performed 
> with Cantera, do you plan to add sensitivity analysis in the near 
> future or are you focussing your development efforts in other areas?
> 
> Regards
> 
> Rob Tranter
> Dept. Chemical Engineering
> University of Illinois at Chicago
